intro: Elaeopleurum monococcum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are surrounded by white ray florets, giving it a daisy-like appearance. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Elaeopleurum monococcum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive blooms and hardy nature.
